canisius.jim

Class Connect

  • java.lang.Object
    • canisius.jim.Connect

  • public final class Connect
extends java.lang.Object
    This class acquires the computer's default Sequencer which is used to store and organize the MIDI data. It also acquires the Receiver to a USB MIDI device such that MIDI messages can be created and sent through the device.

    Note that in order to only transmit MIDI messages stored in the system's default Sequencer to the USB MIDI device's Receiver, you have to disconnect the Sequencer from the system's default Receiver (such as the computer's speakers). This way, the MIDI messages are ONLY sent to the USB MIDI device's Receiver.

    If the program is unable to acquire the the USB MIDI device's Receiver, (which may occur if some other program is using it) then the user is presented with an error message and then they are asked to make sure that any program that may be using the USB MIDI device's Receiver is closed. Once that is done, the user can then tell the program to retry to get the USB MIDI device's Receiver or, if the user so desires, they can exit the program.

    Currently, the USB MIDI device's Receiver is acquired by obtaining an ArrayList of all of the MIDI devices that the computer can find. It then makes a connection with the USB MIDI device whose description matches the String "External MIDI port".

    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    Jon Mrowczynski

    • Constructor Detail

      • Connect

        private Connect()
        A Connect object should not be instantiated.

        This should always be the case to prevent attempts at acquiring the same USB MIDI device. Otherwise an error will be presented stating that the device is being used by some other application (which it will be).

    • Method Detail

      • getUSBReceiver

        public static final javax.sound.midi.Receiver getUSBReceiver()
        Gets the Receiver of the USB MIDI device.
        Returns:
        The Receiver to the USB MIDI device

      • setupConnections

        public static final void setupConnections()
        Sets up the necessary connections between the system's default Sequencer, and the USB MIDI device's Receiver.

      • closeConnections

        public static final void closeConnections()
        Makes sure that all of the connections that were formed when the method setupConnections() was called are properly closed.

      • EstablishUSBConnection

        private static void EstablishUSBConnection()
        Sets up a connection between the computer and the USB MIDI device's Receiver.

        If no USB MIDI device could be found, then an error message is presented and the user has the option to have the program to look for the device again.

        If a USB MIDI device was found, but some other program is using it, then a message is presented to the user stating that they should close the program using the USB MIDI device before they ask the program to attempt to reopen it.

        If either error is presented to the user, they have the option to quit the program.

      • ErrorConnectingUSB

        private static void ErrorConnectingUSB()
        This method is only called when the USB MIDI device could not be found.

        It presents the user with the option to have the program try to find the USB MIDI device again. If the user does not want this to happen, then they also have the option to terminate the program.

      • OpenUSBDevice

        private static void OpenUSBDevice()
        Opens the USB MIDI device for usage.

        If the USB MIDI device cannot be used because another program is using it, then print an error message stating that and that the program that is using it must be closed in order for it to be used for this application.

        if the USB MIDI device has already been opened by the application, then print a message stating that.

      • ErrorOpeningUSB

        private static void ErrorOpeningUSB()
        This method is called when another program is using the USB MIDI device before this program attempted.

        The user is prompted to close the program that may be using the USB MIDI device before attempting to reopen it. If the user does not want to do this however, they also have the option to close the program.

      • EstablishSequencerConnection

        private static void EstablishSequencerConnection()
        Acquires the system's default Sequencer and sets its Transmitter to send to only the USB MIDI device's Receiver.

      • OpenSequencer

        private static void OpenSequencer()
        Opens the system's default Sequencer.

        If it already has been opened by the application, then print a message stating that.

      • closeUSB

        private static void closeUSB()
        Closes the USB MIDI device and states that it has been successfully close.

        If the USB MIDI device has already been closed, then print a message to the console stating that it already has been closed.

      • closeSequencer

        private static void closeSequencer()
